page.title: 09The Dock (cont.)
page.content: Mr Parker then became the chairman of the company. In 1953 the port suffered a setback when disastrous east coast floods overwhelmed part of Felixstowe. In 1958 H.M. Customs & Excise appointed the 1st Landing Officer. The company g- ot permission to use the Hammerhead Cr- ane and the Crane Pier at the Felixsto- we Royal Air Force Station for a heavy lift service up to 50 tons for vessels operated by J.Fisher and Sons LTD. On July 26th 1966 in the early hours of the morning there was a very serious fire that damaged the maltings badly. The first translantic container vessel was worked on the 1st July 1967 and by March 1968 the whole facility was com- pleted at last.The port's plans for the future are building a new terminal next year, although conservationists are concerned about damage to the ecology of the environment at Fagbury cliff.
